> @saiarcot895 , @tjchadaga This seems like a generic build failure in 202511, Can you please take a look
> 
> ```
>       |                                             ^~~~~
> In file included from vpp/SwitchVpp.h:8,
>                  from VirtualSwitchSaiInterfaceFdb.cpp:4:
> vpp/TunnelManager.h:104:32: error: field 'm_router_mac' has incomplete type 'std::array<unsigned char, 6>'
>   104 |         std::array<uint8_t, 6> m_router_mac;
>       |                                ^~~~~~~~~~~~
> In file included from /usr/include/c++/12/bits/stl_map.h:63,
>                  from /usr/include/c++/12/map:61,
>                  from LaneMap.h:7,
>                  from SwitchConfig.h:3,
>                  from SwitchState.h:8,
>                  from SwitchStateBase.h:3,
>                  from VirtualSwitchSaiInterface.h:3,
>                  from VirtualSwitchSaiInterfaceFdb.cpp:1:
> /usr/include/c++/12/tuple:1595:45: note: declaration of 'struct std::array<unsigned char, 6>'
>  1595 |   template<typename _Tp, size_t _Nm> struct array;
>       |                                             ^~~~~
> ```

@vivekrnv - this is known and should be fixed with this PR - https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-sairedis/pull/1745

There is also another issue with the libswsscommon build which is preventing merging of the above PR into 202511. We are currently looking into that

> > @saiarcot895 , @tjchadaga This seems like a generic build failure in 202511, Can you please take a look
> > ```
> >       |                                             ^~~~~
> > In file included from vpp/SwitchVpp.h:8,
> >                  from VirtualSwitchSaiInterfaceFdb.cpp:4:
> > vpp/TunnelManager.h:104:32: error: field 'm_router_mac' has incomplete type 'std::array<unsigned char, 6>'
> >   104 |         std::array<uint8_t, 6> m_router_mac;
> >       |                                ^~~~~~~~~~~~

> >                  from SwitchConfig.h:3,

> >                  from SwitchStateBase.h:3,
> >                  from VirtualSwitchSaiInterface.h:3,
> >                  from VirtualSwitchSaiInterfaceFdb.cpp:1:
> > /usr/include/c++/12/tuple:1595:45: note: declaration of 'struct std::array<unsigned char, 6>'
> >  1595 |   template<typename _Tp, size_t _Nm> struct array;
> >       |                                             ^~~~~
> > ```
> 
> @vivekrnv - this is known and should be fixed with this PR - #1745
> 
> There is also another issue with the libswsscommon build which is preventing merging of the above PR into 202511. We are currently looking into that

I see, thanks

> @vivekrnv - build issues are all resolved now. PR is now failing for coverage

I have corrected the DCO failure following the steps mentioned in https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-sairedis/pull/1737/checks?check_run_id=60148548202. 

```
sonic-sairedis$ gh pr checkout 1737

sonic-sairedis$ git rebase HEAD~1 --signoff

sonic-sairedis$ git push --force-with-lease origin cherry/202511/1668
Enumerating objects: 7, done.
Counting objects: 100% (7/7), done.
Delta compression using up to 32 threads
Compressing objects: 100% (4/4), done.
Writing objects: 100% (4/4), 1.21 KiB | 1.21 MiB/s, done.
Total 4 (delta 3), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 0
remote: Resolving deltas: 100% (3/3), completed with 3 local objects.
To github.com:nexthop-ai/sonic-sairedis.git
 + b134bfea...9d10b13c cherry/202511/1668 -> cherry/202511/1668 (forced update)
111
```
The other failures are due to libswsscommon package installation
```
sudo dpkg -i download/libswsscommon_1.0.0_amd64.deb
Selecting previously unselected package libswsscommon.
(Reading database ... 226854 files and directories currently installed.)
Preparing to unpack .../libswsscommon_1.0.0_amd64.deb ...
Unpacking libswsscommon (1.0.0) ...
dpkg: dependency problems prevent configuration of libswsscommon:
 libswsscommon depends on libboost-serialization1.74.0 (>= 1.74.0+ds1); however:
  Package libboost-serialization1.74.0 is not installed.

dpkg: error processing package libswsscommon (--install):
 dependency problems - leaving unconfigured
Processing triggers for libc-bin (2.36-9+deb12u13) ...
Errors were encountered while processing:
 libswsscommon

##[error]Bash exited with code '1'.
Finishing: Install sonic swss Common
```

@lolyu the issue with setting the buffer to 64 MB is that not every service needs 64MB. This doubles the steady-state memory consumption of orchagent (which does not need that much memory)
